title.narrative: Building Disaster Resilience in Pakistan (BDRP) ‐ ‘Community Based Disaster Risk Management’ Component – Phase 2

description.narrative: Beneficiaries will benefit from disaster-resilient infrastructure (such as safe houses, shelters and WASH facilities) and livelihood protection/agriculture options which will be provided based upon their needs. These needs will be assessed during a risk and resilience profiling exercise which will be done in selected villages during the initial months of Phase 2. Beneficiary communities will also be trained in early warning systems, and mobilized to form Community Disaster Management Committees, which will support disaster risk management.

People living in disaster prone districts who have repeatedly suffered loss of human, physical, financial, social, political and natural assets owing to recurring disasters, forcing them to use negative coping strategies in order to cope with and recover from these shocks. In particular, those poorer people who suffer disproportionately when disasters strike, including women (especially widows), children, people with disabilities, the elderly, religious minorities, landless tenants and share croppers.

The overall outcome of the Building Disaster Resilience in Pakistan (BDRP) program is “increased capacity to reduce disaster risk, through better planning, preparedness, response, and resource allocation at the governmental and community levels.” The objective of the Community-Based Disaster Risk Management (CBDRM) component of BDRP programme is “inclusive community disaster management committees implement plans; financed projects based on risk assessment.”
